snippet: The recent passage of laws in New Jersey and Connecticut that give adopted children more rights to their files is fueling hope that New York will follow suit.
abstract: Bill being negotiated in Albany would not only give thousands of adoptees access to their original birth certificates, it would also allow biological parents to state whether they wish to be contacted directly, through an intermediary or not at all, and to file updated medical information in case their children ever seek it; enactment of similar laws in New Jersey and Connecticut is fueling supporters' hopes that New York will follow suit.
lead_paragraph: The recent passage of laws in New Jersey and Connecticut that give adopted children more rights to their files is fueling hope that New York will follow suit.

headline.main: New York Adoptees Fight for Access to Birth Certificates
headline.print_headline: Adoptees Fight for Access to Birth Certificates
